message.content:
Document the Rust build process in this codebase. Read and describe:
1. Root Cargo.toml - workspace structure
2. engine/Cargo.toml - engine workspace config
3. How to build Rust crates (cargo commands)
4. Any Makefile targets related to Rust

Document what exists without suggesting changes. Focus on concrete commands to run builds.

content.text: I'll document the Rust build process by examining the workspace structure and build configuration files.

content.content:
1→# PMSynapse Root Workspace
     2→#
     3→# This workspace ties together the engine crates and application crates.
     4→# Engine crates (core library, CLI, daemon) live in engine/
     5→# Application crates (desktop Tauri backend) live in apps/
     6→
     7→[workspace]
     8→resolver = "2"
     9→members = [
    10→    # Engine crates
    11→    "engine/snps-core",
    12→    "engine/snps-cli",
    13→    # Application crates
    14→    "apps/desktop/src-tauri",
    15→]
    16→
    17→default-members = [
    18→    "engine/snps-core",
    19→    "engine/snps-cli",
    20→]
    21→
    22→[workspace.package]
    23→version = "0.1.0"
    24→edition = "2021"
    25→license = "Apache-2.0"
    26→repository = "https://github.com/HelixoidLLC/pmsynapse"
    27→authors = ["Helixoid LLC"]
    28→description = "AI-enabled end-to-end project management system"
    29→
    30→[workspace.dependencies]
    31→# Internal crates
    32→snps-core = { path = "engine/snps-core" }
    33→
    34→# Async runtime
    35→tokio = { version = "1", features = ["full"] }
    36→
    37→# Serialization
    38→serde = { version = "1", features = ["derive"] }
    39→serde_json = "1"
    40→
    41→# Error handling
    42→anyhow = "1"
    43→thiserror = "1"
    44→
    45→# Storage - using rusqlite for MVP, CozoDB later when dependency issues resolved
    46→rusqlite = { version = "0.37", features = ["bundled"] }
    47→# Graph & Vector Database (CozoDB) - temporarily disabled due to dependency conflicts
    48→# cozo = { version = "0.7", default-features = true }
    49→
    50→# HTTP Client for LLM APIs
    51→reqwest = { version = "0.12", features = ["json", "stream"] }
    52→async-trait = "0.1"
    53→
    54→# CLI
    55→clap = { version = "4", features = ["derive", "env"] }
    56→colored = "2"
    57→indicatif = "0.17"
    58→dialoguer = "0.11"
    59→directories = "5"
    60→dirs = "5"
    61→chrono = "0.4"
    62→hostname = "0.4"
    63→
    64→# Logging
    65→tracing = "0.1"
    66→tracing-subscriber = { version = "0.3", features = ["env-filter"] }
    67→
    68→# Tauri
    69→tauri = "2"
    70→tauri-build = "2"
    71→tauri-plugin-fs = "2"
    72→tauri-plugin-shell = "2"
    73→tauri-plugin-clipboard-manager = "2"
    74→tauri-plugin-notification = "2"
    75→tauri-plugin-log = "2"
    76→tauri-plugin-store = "2"
    77→
    78→# Testing
    79→insta = { version = "1", features = ["yaml"] }
    80→tempfile = "3"
    81→assert_cmd = "2"
    82→predicates = "3"
    83→
    84→[workspace.lints.rust]
    85→unsafe_code = "warn"
    86→unreachable_pub = "warn"
    87→
    88→[workspace.lints.clippy]
    89→pedantic = { level = "warn", priority = -2 }
    90→missing_errors_doc = "allow"
    91→missing_panics_doc = "allow"
    92→module_name_repetitions = "allow"
    93→
    94→[profile.release]
    95→lto = "thin"
    96→codegen-units = 16
    97→strip = true
    98→
    99→[profile.dev]
   100→opt-level = 0
   101→debug = true
   102→

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

file.content:
# PMSynapse Root Workspace
#
# This workspace ties together the engine crates and application crates.
# Engine crates (core library, CLI, daemon) live in engine/
# Application crates (desktop Tauri backend) live in apps/

[workspace]
resolver = "2"
members = [
    # Engine crates
    "engine/snps-core",
    "engine/snps-cli",
    # Application crates
    "apps/desktop/src-tauri",
]

default-members = [
    "engine/snps-core",
    "engine/snps-cli",
]

[workspace.package]
version = "0.1.0"
edition = "2021"
license = "Apache-2.0"
repository = "https://github.com/HelixoidLLC/pmsynapse"
authors = ["Helixoid LLC"]
description = "AI-enabled end-to-end project management system"

[workspace.dependencies]
# Internal crates
snps-core = { path = "engine/snps-core" }

# Async runtime
tokio = { version = "1", features = ["full"] }

# Serialization
serde = { version = "1", features = ["derive"] }
serde_json = "1"

# Error handling
anyhow = "1"
thiserror = "1"

# Storage - using rusqlite for MVP, CozoDB later when dependency issues resolved
rusqlite = { version = "0.37", features = ["bundled"] }
# Graph & Vector Database (CozoDB) - temporarily disabled due to dependency conflicts
# cozo = { version = "0.7", default-features = true }

# HTTP Client for LLM APIs
reqwest = { version = "0.12", features = ["json", "stream"] }
async-trait = "0.1"

# CLI
clap = { version = "4", features = ["derive", "env"] }
colored = "2"
indicatif = "0.17"
dialoguer = "0.11"
directories = "5"
dirs = "5"
chrono = "0.4"
hostname = "0.4"

# Logging
tracing = "0.1"
tracing-subscriber = { version = "0.3", features = ["env-filter"] }

# Tauri
tauri = "2"
tauri-build = "2"
tauri-plugin-fs = "2"
tauri-plugin-shell = "2"
tauri-plugin-clipboard-manager = "2"
tauri-plugin-notification = "2"
tauri-plugin-log = "2"
tauri-plugin-store = "2"

# Testing
insta = { version = "1", features = ["yaml"] }
tempfile = "3"
assert_cmd = "2"
predicates = "3"

[workspace.lints.rust]
unsafe_code = "warn"
unreachable_pub = "warn"

[workspace.lints.clippy]
pedantic = { level = "warn", priority = -2 }
missing_errors_doc = "allow"
missing_panics_doc = "allow"
module_name_repetitions = "allow"

[profile.release]
lto = "thin"
codegen-units = 16
strip = true

[profile.dev]
opt-level = 0
debug = true

file.content:
# PMSynapse Engine Workspace
#
# This workspace contains all Rust crates for the PMSynapse engine.
# Following BAML's pattern of isolating Rust code in a dedicated directory.

[workspace]
resolver = "2"
members = [
    "snps-core",
    "snps-cli",
    # Future crates:
    # "snps-daemon",
    # "snps-graph",
    # "snps-llm",
    # "snps-idlc",
]

default-members = [
    "snps-core",
    "snps-cli",
]

[workspace.package]
version = "0.1.0"
edition = "2021"
license = "Apache-2.0"
repository = "https://github.com/HelixoidLLC/pmsynapse"
authors = ["Helixoid LLC"]
description = "AI-enabled end-to-end project management system"

[workspace.dependencies]
# Internal crates
snps-core = { path = "snps-core" }

# Async runtime
tokio = { version = "1", features = ["full"] }

# Serialization
serde = { version = "1", features = ["derive"] }
serde_json = "1"

# Error handling
anyhow = "1"
thiserror = "1"

# Storage - using rusqlite for MVP, CozoDB later when dependency issues resolved
rusqlite = { version = "0.37", features = ["bundled"] }
# Graph & Vector Database (CozoDB) - temporarily disabled due to dependency conflicts
# cozo = { version = "0.7", default-features = true }

# HTTP Client for LLM APIs
reqwest = { version = "0.12", features = ["json", "stream"] }
async-trait = "0.1"

# CLI
clap = { version = "4", features = ["derive", "env"] }
colored = "2"
indicatif = "0.17"
dialoguer = "0.11"
directories = "5"
dirs = "5"
chrono = "0.4"
hostname = "0.4"

# Logging
tracing = "0.1"
tracing-subscriber = { version = "0.3", features = ["env-filter"] }

# Testing
insta = { version = "1", features = ["yaml"] }
tempfile = "3"
assert_cmd = "2"
predicates = "3"

[workspace.lints.rust]
unsafe_code = "warn"
unreachable_pub = "warn"

[workspace.lints.clippy]
pedantic = { level = "warn", priority = -2 }
missing_errors_doc = "allow"
missing_panics_doc = "allow"
module_name_repetitions = "allow"

[profile.release]
lto = "thin"
codegen-units = 16
strip = true

[profile.dev]
opt-level = 0
debug = true

content.content:
1→.PHONY: all build test clean dev lint fmt check desktop cli install help engine
     2→.PHONY: check-test lint-engine githooks setup-ci check-local
     3→
     4→# Default target
     5→all: build
     6→
     7→# Help
     8→help:
     9→	@echo "PMSynapse Development Commands"
    10→	@echo ""
    11→	@echo "Usage: make [target]"
    12→	@echo ""
    13→	@echo "Build Targets:"
    14→	@echo "  build        Build all Rust crates"
    15→	@echo "  build-release Build all crates in release mode"
    16→	@echo "  engine       Build engine crates only"
    17→	@echo "  cli          Build CLI tool"
    18→	@echo "  desktop      Build desktop app"
    19→	@echo ""
    20→	@echo "Test Targets:"
    21→	@echo "  test         Run all tests"
    22→	@echo "  test-engine  Run engine tests only"
    23→	@echo "  test-integ   Run integration tests only"
    24→	@echo ""
    25→	@echo "Development Targets:"
    26→	@echo "  dev          Run development server (via snps CLI)"
    27→	@echo "  desktop-dev  Run desktop app in dev mode"
    28→	@echo "  daemon       Start daemon in foreground"
    29→	@echo ""
    30→	@echo "Code Quality:"
    31→	@echo "  lint         Run clippy lints"
    32→	@echo "  fmt          Format code"
    33→	@echo "  fmt-check    Check formatting"
    34→	@echo "  check        Run cargo check"
    35→	@echo ""
    36→	@echo "Other:"
    37→	@echo "  clean        Clean build artifacts"
    38→	@echo "  install      Install dependencies"
    39→	@echo "  setup        Initial project setup"
    40→	@echo "  docs         Generate documentation"
    41→
    42→# Build all Rust crates
    43→build:
    44→	cargo build --workspace
    45→
    46→# Build release
    47→build-release:
    48→	cargo build --workspace --release
    49→
    50→# Build engine crates only
    51→engine:
    52→	cargo build -p snps-core -p snps-cli
    53→
    54→# Build engine crates in release mode
    55→engine-release:
    56→	cargo build -p snps-core -p snps-cli --release
    57→
    58→# Run all tests
    59→test:
    60→	cargo test --workspace --all-features
    61→
    62→# Run engine tests only
    63→test-engine:
    64→	cargo test -p snps-core -p snps-cli --all-features
    65→
    66→# Run integration tests only
    67→test-integ:
    68→	cargo test --test '*' --all-features
    69→
    70→# Run clippy lints
    71→lint:
    72→	cargo clippy --all-targets --all-features -- -D warnings
    73→
    74→# Run clippy on engine crates only (no GTK dependencies)
    75→lint-engine:
    76→	cargo clippy -p snps-core -p snps-cli --all-targets --all-features -- -D warnings
    77→
    78→# Format code
    79→fmt:
    80→	cargo fmt --all
    81→
    82→# Check formatting
    83→fmt-check:
    84→	cargo fmt --all -- --check
    85→
    86→# Cargo check
    87→check:
    88→	cargo check --workspace --all-features
    89→
    90→# Clean build artifacts
    91→clean:
    92→	cargo clean
    93→	rm -rf apps/desktop/dist
    94→	rm -rf apps/desktop/src-tauri/target
    95→
    96→# Development server (using snps CLI)
    97→dev:
    98→	cargo run -p snps-cli -- dev
    99→
   100→# Start daemon in foreground
   101→daemon:
   102→	cargo run -p snps-cli -- daemon start --foreground
   103→
   104→# Build desktop app (requires GTK on Linux)
   105→desktop:
   106→	@if pkg-config --exists gtk+-3.0 2>/dev/null; then \
   107→		cd apps/desktop && pnpm tauri build; \
   108→	else \
   109→		echo "⚠️  GTK not found. Skipping desktop build."; \
   110→		echo "   Install GTK: sudo apt install libgtk-3-dev libwebkit2gtk-4.1-dev"; \
   111→	fi
   112→
   113→# Build desktop app for development (requires GTK on Linux)
   114→desktop-dev:
   115→	@if pkg-config --exists gtk+-3.0 2>/dev/null; then \
   116→		cd apps/desktop && pnpm tauri dev; \
   117→	else \
   118→		echo "⚠️  GTK not found. Skipping desktop dev."; \
   119→		echo "   Install GTK: sudo apt install libgtk-3-dev libwebkit2gtk-4.1-dev"; \
   120→	fi
   121→
   122→# Build CLI
   123→cli:
   124→	cargo build -p snps-cli --release
   125→
   126→# Install CLI locally
   127→cli-install:
   128→	cargo install --path engine/snps-cli
   129→
   130→# Install all dependencies
   131→install:
   132→	pnpm install
   133→
   134→# Initial setup
   135→setup: install githooks
   136→	@echo ""
   137→	@echo "✅ PMSynapse setup complete!"
   138→	@echo ""
   139→	@echo "Quick start:"
   140→	@echo "  make engine      - Build Rust engine"
   141→	@echo "  make test-engine - Run tests"
   142→	@echo "  make dev         - Start full development environment"
   143→	@echo "  make daemon      - Start daemon in foreground"
   144→	@echo "  make desktop-dev - Start desktop app in dev mode (requires GTK)"
   145→
   146→# Run all checks and tests (engine-safe, for pre-push)
   147→check-test: fmt-check lint-engine test-engine
   148→	@echo "✅ All checks and tests passed!"
   149→
   150→# Run all checks (for CI - engine only to avoid GTK issues)
   151→ci: fmt-check lint-engine test-engine
   152→	@echo "✅ CI checks passed!"
   153→
   154→# CI setup
   155→setup-ci:
   156→	@echo "Setting up CI environment..."
   157→	rustup component add clippy rustfmt
   158→
   159→# Install git hooks
   160→githooks:
   161→	@echo "Installing git hooks..."
   162→	@mkdir -p .git/hooks
   163→	@cp scripts/pre-push .git/hooks/pre-push
   164→	@chmod +x .git/hooks/pre-push
   165→	@echo "✅ Git hooks installed!"
   166→	@echo "   Pre-push hook will run: make check-test"
   167→
   168→# Check for local branches (block pushing)
   169→check-local:
   170→	@if git rev-parse --abbrev-ref HEAD | grep -q "^local/"; then \
   171→		echo "❌ Cannot push local/* branches"; \
   172→		exit 1; \
   173→	fi
   174→
   175→# Documentation
   176→docs:
   177→	cargo doc --workspace --no-deps --open
   178→
   179→# Snapshot testing
   180→snapshots:
   181→	cargo insta review
   182→
   183→# Accept all pending snapshots
   184→snapshots-accept:
   185→	cargo insta accept
   186→

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

1→[package]
     2→name = "snps-core"
     3→version.workspace = true
     4→edition.workspace = true
     5→license.workspace = true
     6→description = "PMSynapse core library - knowledge graph, LLM integration, IDLC workflow"
     7→
     8→[lib]
     9→name = "snps_core"
    10→path = "src/lib.rs"
    11→
    12→[features]
    13→default = []
    14→
    15→[dependencies]
    16→# Workspace dependencies
    17→tokio = { workspace = true }
    18→serde = { workspace = true }
    19→serde_json = { workspace = true }
    20→anyhow = { workspace = true }
    21→thiserror = { workspace = true }
    22→async-trait = { workspace = true }
    23→tracing = { workspace = true }
    24→
    25→# Storage - SQLite for MVP
    26→rusqlite = { workspace = true }
    27→
    28→# LLM integration
    29→reqwest = { workspace = true }
    30→
    31→# UUID generation
    32→uuid = { version = "1", features = ["v4", "serde"] }
    33→
    34→# Date/time
    35→chrono = { version = "0.4", features = ["serde"] }
    36→
    37→[dev-dependencies]
    38→insta = { workspace = true }
    39→tokio-test = "0.4"
    40→

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

file.content:
[package]
name = "snps-cli"
version.workspace = true
edition.workspace = true
license.workspace = true
description = "PMSynapse CLI - command line interface for project management"

[[bin]]
name = "snps"
path = "src/main.rs"

[dependencies]
# Core library
snps-core = { path = "../snps-core" }

# Workspace dependencies
tokio = { workspace = true }
serde = { workspace = true }
serde_json = { workspace = true }
anyhow = { workspace = true }
clap = { workspace = true }
tracing = { workspace = true }
tracing-subscriber = { workspace = true }

# CLI-specific
colored = "2"
indicatif = "0.17"
dialoguer = "0.11"
directories = "5"
dirs = "5"
chrono = "0.4"
hostname = "0.4"

[dev-dependencies]
assert_cmd = "2"
predicates = "3"
tempfile = "3"

content.content:
1→[toolchain]
     2→channel = "1.87.0"
     3→components = [
     4→  "rustfmt",
     5→  "clippy",

     8→]

    14→]

file.content:
{
  "name": "pmsynapse",
  "version": "0.1.0",
  "private": true,
  "description": "AI-enabled end-to-end project management system",
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "https://github.com/HelixoidLLC/pmsynapse"
  },
  "license": "Apache-2.0",
  "scripts": {
    "build": "turbo run build",
    "build:engine": "cargo build --workspace --release",
    "build:debug": "cargo build --workspace",
    "build:all": "turbo run build && cargo build --workspace --release",
    "dev": "turbo run dev",
    "dev:desktop": "pnpm --filter @pmsynapse/desktop dev",
    "dev:vscode": "pnpm --filter pmsynapse dev",
    "dev:rpc": "pnpm --filter @pmsynapse/rpc dev",
    "lint": "turbo run lint",
    "lint:engine": "cargo clippy -p snps-core -p snps-cli --all-targets --all-features -- -D warnings",
    "lint:all": "turbo run lint && pnpm lint:engine",
    "test": "turbo run test",
    "test:engine": "cargo test -p snps-core -p snps-cli --all-features",
    "test:all": "turbo run test && pnpm test:engine",
    "typecheck": "turbo run typecheck",
    "clean": "turbo run clean && cargo clean",
    "clean:all": "turbo run clean && cargo clean && rm -rf node_modules",
    "format": "prettier --write . && cargo fmt --all",
    "format:check": "prettier --check . && cargo fmt --all -- --check",
    "release": "turbo run release",
    "release:engine": "cargo build --workspace --release",
    "release:vscode": "pnpm --filter pmsynapse package",
    "release:desktop": "pnpm --filter @pmsynapse/desktop tauri:build",
    "release:all": "pnpm release:engine && turbo run release",
    "package:vscode": "pnpm --filter pmsynapse package",
    "ci": "pnpm format:check && pnpm lint:all && pnpm test:all",
    "prepare": "pnpm build"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@types/node": "^22.0.0",
    "prettier": "^3.4.0",
    "turbo": "^2.3.0",
    "typescript": "^5.7.0"
  },
  "packageManager": "pnpm@9.15.0",
  "engines": {
    "node": ">=20",
    "pnpm": ">=9"
  }
}

content.text:
## Analysis: Rust Build Process in PMSynapse

### Overview
PMSynapse uses a nested Cargo workspace structure following BAML's organizational pattern. The root workspace at `/Users/igor/Dev/Helixoid/pmsynapse/Cargo.toml` includes both engine crates (under `engine/`) and application crates (under `apps/`). The `engine/` directory contains its own workspace configuration at `/Users/igor/Dev/Helixoid/pmsynapse/engine/Cargo.toml`.

### Workspace Structure

#### Root Workspace (`/Cargo.toml`)

**Workspace Members** (lines 9-15):
- `engine/snps-core` - Core library
- `engine/snps-cli` - CLI binary
- `apps/desktop/src-tauri` - Tauri desktop backend

**Default Members** (lines 17-20):
- Only engine crates (`snps-core`, `snps-cli`) are built by default
- Desktop app requires explicit inclusion due to GTK dependencies

**Resolver** (line 8):
- Uses Cargo resolver v2

**Workspace Package Metadata** (lines 22-28):
- Version: 0.1.0
- Edition: 2021
- License: Apache-2.0
- Repository: https://github.com/HelixoidLLC/pmsynapse

**Shared Dependencies** (lines 30-82):
- Internal: `snps-core` (line 32)
- Async: `tokio` with "full" features (line 35)
- Serialization: `serde`, `serde_json` (lines 38-39)
- Error handling: `anyhow`, `thiserror` (lines 42-43)
- Storage: `rusqlite` with "bundled" feature (line 46)
- CozoDB commented out (line 48)
- HTTP: `reqwest` with json/stream features (line 51)
- CLI tools: `clap`, `colored`, `indicatif`, `dialoguer` (lines 55-62)
- Logging: `tracing`, `tracing-subscriber` (lines 65-66)
- Tauri plugins (lines 69-76)
- Testing: `insta`, `tempfile`, `assert_cmd`, `predicates` (lines 79-82)

**Lints** (lines 84-92):
- Rust: warns on `unsafe_code`, `unreachable_pub`
- Clippy: pedantic mode with some allows

**Build Profiles** (lines 94-101):
- Release: thin LTO, 16 codegen units, strip symbols
- Dev: no optimization, debug symbols enabled

#### Engine Workspace (`/engine/Cargo.toml`)

**Workspace Members** (lines 8-16):
- `snps-core`
- `snps-cli`
- Comments indicate future crates: `snps-daemon`, `snps-graph`, `snps-llm`, `snps-idlc`

**Configuration**: Mirrors root workspace (lines 23-92)
- Same version, edition, license, authors
- Identical workspace dependencies
- Same lint configuration
- Identical build profiles

**Internal Dependencies** (line 33):
- `snps-core` path is relative: `{ path = "snps-core" }`

### Individual Crate Configurations

#### snps-core (`/engine/snps-core/Cargo.toml`)

**Package** (lines 1-6):
- Name: `snps-core`
- Inherits version, edition, license from workspace
- Description: "PMSynapse core library - knowledge graph, LLM integration, IDLC workflow"

**Library** (lines 8-10):
- Name: `snps_core`
- Path: `src/lib.rs`

**Features** (lines 12-13):
- Default features: empty array

**Dependencies** (lines 15-35):
- Workspace deps: tokio, serde, serde_json, anyhow, thiserror, async-trait, tracing, rusqlite, reqwest
- Additional: `uuid` with v4/serde features (line 32), `chrono` with serde (line 35)

**Dev Dependencies** (lines 37-39):
- `insta` (workspace), `tokio-test` 0.4

#### snps-cli (`/engine/snps-cli/Cargo.toml`)

**Package** (lines 1-6):
- Name: `snps-cli`
- Inherits workspace metadata

**Binary** (lines 8-10):
- Name: `snps`
- Path: `src/main.rs`

**Dependencies** (lines 12-32):
- `snps-core` from `../snps-core` (line 14)
- Workspace: tokio, serde, serde_json, anyhow, clap, tracing, tracing-subscriber
- CLI-specific: colored, indicatif, dialoguer, directories, dirs, chrono, hostname (lines 26-32)

**Dev Dependencies** (lines 34-37):
- assert_cmd, predicates, tempfile

#### pmsynapse-desktop (`/apps/desktop/src-tauri/Cargo.toml`)

**Package** (lines 1-6):
- Name: `pmsynapse-desktop`
- Inherits workspace metadata

**Library** (lines 8-10):
- Name: `pmsynapse_desktop_lib`
- Crate types: lib, cdylib, staticlib

**Build Dependencies** (lines 12-13):
- `tauri-build` from workspace

**Dependencies** (lines 15-32):
- `snps-core` from `../../../engine/snps-core` (line 17)
- Tauri: core + 6 plugins (fs, shell, clipboard-manager, notification, log, store) (lines 20-26)
- Workspace: serde, serde_json, tokio, tracing

**Features** (lines 34-36):
- Default: `["custom-protocol"]`
- `custom-protocol`: enables `tauri/custom-protocol`

### Rust Toolchain (`/rust-toolchain.toml`)

**Channel** (line 2):
- Pinned to Rust 1.87.0

**Components** (lines 3-8):
- rustfmt, clippy, rust-analyzer, rust-src

**Targets** (lines 9-14):
- Linux: x86_64, aarch64
- macOS: x86_64 (Intel), aarch64 (Apple Silicon)

### Cargo Build Commands

#### Direct Cargo Commands

**Build all workspace crates**:
```bash
cargo build --workspace
```

**Build in release mode**:
```bash
cargo build --workspace --release
```

**Build engine crates only**:
```bash
cargo build -p snps-core -p snps-cli
```

**Build specific crate**:
```bash
cargo build -p snps-core
cargo build -p snps-cli
cargo build -p pmsynapse-desktop
```

**Check without building**:
```bash
cargo check --workspace --all-features
```

**Run CLI**:
```bash
cargo run -p snps-cli -- <args>
# Example:
cargo run -p snps-cli -- init
cargo run -p snps-cli -- daemon start --foreground
```

**Install CLI locally**:
```bash
cargo install --path engine/snps-cli
```

### Makefile Targets (`/Makefile`)

#### Build Targets

**`make build`** (line 43):
- Command: `cargo build --workspace`

**`make build-release`** (line 47):
- Command: `cargo build --workspace --release`

**`make engine`** (line 51):
- Command: `cargo build -p snps-core -p snps-cli`
- Builds engine crates only

**`make engine-release`** (line 55):
- Command: `cargo build -p snps-core -p snps-cli --release`

**`make cli`** (line 123):
- Command: `cargo build -p snps-cli --release`
- Builds CLI in release mode

**`make cli-install`** (line 127):
- Command: `cargo install --path engine/snps-cli`
- Installs CLI to cargo bin directory

**`make desktop`** (lines 105-111):
- Checks for GTK using `pkg-config --exists gtk+-3.0`
- Runs `cd apps/desktop && pnpm tauri build` if GTK found
- Shows warning and installation instructions if GTK missing

**`make desktop-dev`** (lines 114-120):
- Checks for GTK
- Runs `cd apps/desktop && pnpm tauri dev` if GTK found

#### Test Targets

**`make test`** (line 59):
- Command: `cargo test --workspace --all-features`

**`make test-engine`** (line 63):
- Command: `cargo test -p snps-core -p snps-cli --all-features`

**`make test-integ`** (line 67):
- Command: `cargo test --test '*' --all-features`
- Runs integration tests only

#### Code Quality Targets

**`make lint`** (line 71):
- Command: `cargo clippy --all-targets --all-features -- -D warnings`

**`make lint-engine`** (line 75):
- Command: `cargo clippy -p snps-core -p snps-cli --all-targets --all-features -- -D warnings`
- Engine crates only (avoids GTK dependencies)

**`make fmt`** (line 79):
- Command: `cargo fmt --all`

**`make fmt-check`** (line 83):
- Command: `cargo fmt --all -- --check`
- Verifies formatting without modifying files

**`make check`** (line 87):
- Command: `cargo check --workspace --all-features`

#### Pre-commit Checks

**`make check-test`** (line 147):
- Runs: `fmt-check lint-engine test-engine`
- Used by pre-push git hook

**`make ci`** (line 151):
- Runs: `fmt-check lint-engine test-engine`
- Engine-only to avoid GTK dependencies in CI

**`make setup-ci`** (line 155):
- Command: `rustup component add clippy rustfmt`

#### Development Targets

**`make dev`** (line 97):
- Command: `cargo run -p snps-cli -- dev`
- Starts full development environment

**`make daemon`** (line 101):
- Command: `cargo run -p snps-cli -- daemon start --foreground`

#### Other Targets

**`make clean`** (lines 91-94):
- Runs `cargo clean`
- Removes `apps/desktop/dist`
- Removes `apps/desktop/src-tauri/target`

**`make docs`** (line 176):
- Command: `cargo doc --workspace --no-deps --open`

**`make snapshots`** (line 180):
- Command: `cargo insta review`

**`make snapshots-accept`** (line 184):
- Command: `cargo insta accept`

**`make setup`** (line 135):
- Runs: `install githooks`
- Initial project setup

**`make githooks`** (lines 160-166):
- Creates `.git/hooks` directory
- Copies `scripts/pre-push` to `.git/hooks/pre-push`
- Makes hook executable
- Pre-push hook runs `make check-test`

### pnpm Scripts (`/package.json`)

**Build Scripts** (lines 12-15):
- `build`: `turbo run build`
- `build:engine`: `cargo build --workspace --release`
- `build:debug`: `cargo build --workspace`
- `build:all`: `turbo run build && cargo build --workspace --release`

**Lint Scripts** (lines 20-22):
- `lint`: `turbo run lint`
- `lint:engine`: `cargo clippy -p snps-core -p snps-cli --all-targets --all-features -- -D warnings`
- `lint:all`: `turbo run lint && pnpm lint:engine`

**Test Scripts** (lines 23-25):
- `test`: `turbo run test`
- `test:engine`: `cargo test -p snps-core -p snps-cli --all-features`
- `test:all`: `turbo run test && pnpm test:engine`

**Format Scripts** (lines 29-30):
- `format`: `prettier --write . && cargo fmt --all`
- `format:check`: `prettier --check . && cargo fmt --all -- --check`

**Release Scripts** (lines 31-35):
- `release`: `turbo run release`
- `release:engine`: `cargo build --workspace --release`
- `release:vscode`: `pnpm --filter pmsynapse package`
- `release:desktop`: `pnpm --filter @pmsynapse/desktop tauri:build`
- `release:all`: `pnpm release:engine && turbo run release`

**CI Script** (line 37):
- `ci`: `pnpm format:check && pnpm lint:all && pnpm test:all`

### Build Flow Summary

**Standard Development Build**:
1. Run `cargo build` or `make build`
2. Builds default members: snps-core, snps-cli
3. Desktop app excluded by default

**Engine-Only Build**:
1. Run `cargo build -p snps-core -p snps-cli` or `make engine`
2. Avoids desktop app and GTK dependencies

**Full Workspace Build**:
1. Run `cargo build --workspace`
2. Includes desktop app (requires GTK on Linux)

**Release Build**:
1. Run `cargo build --workspace --release` or `make build-release`
2. Uses profile at lines 94-97 of root Cargo.toml
3. Applies thin LTO, strips symbols

**Desktop App Build**:
1. Requires GTK (checked via pkg-config)
2. Run `make desktop` or `cd apps/desktop && pnpm tauri build`
3. Frontend built via Vite, backend via Cargo
